Section.Catchline: Grounds for issuance of search warrant.

SectionBody.Text: Upon proper affidavits being made, a search warrant may be issued under the provisions of this chapter upon any of the following grounds:

Subsection.Text: When the property shall have been stolen or embezzled in violation of law;
When any property shall have been used:

Paragraph.Text: As a means to commit any crime;
In connection with gambling, gambling implements and appliances; or
In violation of s. 847.011 or other laws in reference to obscene prints and literature;

Subsection.Text: When any property constitutes evidence relevant to proving that a felony has been committed;
When any property is being held or possessed:

Paragraph.Text: In violation of any of the laws prohibiting the manufacture, sale, and transportation of intoxicating liquors;
In violation of the fish and game laws;
In violation of the laws relative to food and drug; or
In violation of the laws relative to citrus disease pursuant to s. 581.184; or

Subsection.Text: When the laws in relation to cruelty to animals, as provided in chapter 828, have been or are violated in any particular building or place.

SectionBody.Text: This section also applies to any papers or documents used as a means of or in aid of the commission of any offense against the laws of the state.
